question: Resource depletion occurs when natural resources are used up faster than they can be replaced.
Overpopulation decreases the demand for food, water, energy, and land.
Leaving the tap open while brushing your teeth is an example of resource conservation.
Deforestation leads to a decrease in oxygen production.
Industrialization increases the consumption of raw materials like coal, iron, and oil.
Oil drilling in oceans has no impact on marine life.
Pollution can make natural resources unusable.
Melting glaciers increase the amount of freshwater available.
Excessive use of chemical fertilizers improves soil quality permanently.
Water scarcity affects industries as well as farming and drinking water supply.
Loss of forests does not affect animal habitats.
An energy crisis can occur due to the depletion of fossil fuels.
Droughts in India have no impact on food prices.
Burning fossil fuels does not contribute to climate change.
Shortage of natural resources can lead to job losses and economic issues.
